intro: Cumetea fragrans, commonly known as the fragrant cumetea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its aromatic leaves and clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. The plant's botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and ethnobotanical studies.
